name: Fort Lauderdale Marriott North

reviews.text: Dear trip advisors!
reviews.title: Incredible Service and Professionalism!

reviews.text: I love the south Florida area but for the first time I stayed in Ft. Lauderdale versus Miami in the North Lauderdale Marriott located on 6650 North Andrews Ave! The stay and room was wonderful! I received the best service from a server from Guatemala called Melania! Her service was first class. I was late for a meeting and she served and guided me very well! Karla was also very sweet and professional too. I would definitely recommend this hotel again! I travel a lot and often to Marriott as I am a rewards member.
reviews.title: Great Pool and Outdoor Lounging Area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Marriott with a total of 7 family members for three days before a family cruise. It was a great hotel for our group because the pool and workout area are located on the 4th floor and the area is open 24 hours! It was great. There is a nice big area under an awning with outdoor furniture and we were able to hang out there and visit and relax,. There's also a very large whirlpool spa along with the pool. The location is a bit remote...there's nothing in walking distance although there is a small shopping center less than a half mile up the road. We had a car so it was not a problem. The hotel is very nice, the staff was great and very friendly. Nice bar with starbucks coffee. Would choose this hotel again if I was with a group.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel. On the beach.

reviews.text: We had an excellent time at this hotel. I really wanted a hotel on the beach - I didn't want to stay across the street. The reality was that the beach was not really walkable and we truly spent all of our time at the pool. The view from the room was very nice but we could have had the same view across the street at any hotel.
reviews.title: FINE HOTEL

reviews.text: Don't bother with the cabanas. The view of the ocean is blocked by the bushes. One of the things we loved is they have wide lounge chairs for two people to share. They had a cool movie night at the pool, which kept the kids quiet. We don't have kids and were not looking forward to having them run and scream all over the pool but the movie kept them very quiet.
reviews.title: rooms have musky odor

reviews.text: Just close to the business place I was visiting, otherwise, location is awful !!
reviews.title: In the middle of nowhere interesting

reviews.text: The hotel itself stands for the Marriott brand, although the hallways can look a littlle less 90s. The "fitness facility" - it is NOT a gym - could be better. At least there was free parking.
reviews.title: Top Notch

reviews.text: The staff at this Marriott would make a Ritz-Carlton manager proud. Excellent service everywhere; check-in/out, room, concierge lounge, etc. I also met the GM - Alan Cristaniello. He was very welcoming and interested in my feedback. The facility was well kept, everything was clean, bed was nice. This will be my Fort Lauderdale "home" in the future.
reviews.title: Very clean and the second bedroom was comfortable (first mattress was saggy)

reviews.text: Many good things about hotel - friendly staff, very clean rooms but also several problems. Bed in first room so saggy that I had back ache ((524). We changed rooms. In neither room was there cold water. Always luke warm. had to go get ice to get cold water to drink. In neither room was there anywhere next to sink to hang hand towel. small sink area was like a 2 star motel. In our second room, there was no bedside table or reading lamp on one side of the bed (924). Neither sink nor tub drain in 924 worked well.
reviews.title: great hotel , great value

reviews.text: My major problem was that I am highly allergic to air sprays (air freshener and cleaning sprays). They make me cough and it is hard for me to breathe. I called housekeeping. I got the operator who would not connect me to housekeeping but told me she would convey to housekeeping my request that no sprays be used in the room (we stayed 5 nights). I even left a note attached to our door. Notwithstanding all my efforts, they still sprayed in the room every day. That meant that each night when we returned, I had to turn the AC on full blast and leave the door to the room open with a chair to air it out for 20 minutes. I was annoyed by the lack of follow through by staff. I called every day with same request!
reviews.title: Great pool, wonderful bed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good: Free covered parking, free Intenet, excellent free concierge breakfast (weekday only), very friendly staff, good bag man with dining tips, Marriott bed was extremely comfortable, nice view from the 16th floor.
reviews.title: Good for points stay

reviews.text: Fair: This hotel has an old world charm, if you know what I mean. Since the hotel location is in far north Fort Lauderdale, I would recommend staying here only on Marriott points.
reviews.title: Met Our Needs Pre-Cruise But Won't be Staying Here Again

reviews.text: Poor: Sunday breakfast buffet on the main hotel floor as very crowded and service was almost non existent. Buffet selections were typical Marriott. The waiter came with coffee for what seemed like 20 minutes after we were seated, then waiter ignored my wife's request for cream for her coffee. When the two us got ready to leave we got our ticket with a mandatory service charge of something like 20%. Later I spoke with "Louis" the hotel manager who said he was unaware of the mandatory service charge for serve yourself buffet.
reviews.title: Best Hotel Ever

reviews.text: Tip: If you email Michael McClain the front office manager mmcClain@marriottnorth.com and ask for a high room and speak nicely, you just might get a concierge level room. Keep in mind that the concierge level wine goes for eight bucks a glass for ordinary label wine.
reviews.title: Horrific

reviews.text: All in all this is nice place to stay but I would only stay want to stay here on points.
reviews.title: Worst Hotel that I have stayed in

reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights pre-cruise and this hotel fit the bill as we just used it as a base to shop and dine.
reviews.title: Clean, quiet, need a car

reviews.text: The rooms are spacious and clean and quiet which for me at least are important factors and this hotel fit the bill on all counts. We had breakfast one day and it was fair although pricier than restaurants off-site.
reviews.title: Friendly Place but nowhere to go

reviews.text: We did not book as part of our cruise we did notice a lot of other cruise ship passengers with cruise desks in the hospitality area.
reviews.title: Very quiet, pleasant stay.

reviews.text: I stayed here during a short business trip. The rooms were great and the hotel facilities more than acceptable. The pool and gym is uncrowded as it isn't really a holiday hotel. Moreover, I found the staff very friendly and chatty. They even drove me to my meeting as it was just 10 minutes drive away. The restaurant had a reasonable variety and the food was generally pretty good, especially breakfast!
reviews.title: Great night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only criticism, there was nowhere to take a stroll to nearby. Its quite a commercial area so its a taxi ride to go anywhere else for dinner. Even so, highly recommended and is where i'll choose next time I'm visiting.
reviews.title: Very pleasant stay at the Marriott

aka: Fort Lauderdale Marriott North Hotel Fort Lauderdale
description: The Marriott North Fort Lauderdale Hotel resides in the lush Cypress Creek Florida Nature Preserve, bestowing an enchanting backdrop for our guests all year round.
